job_title: Peer Learning Assistant in Gettysburg, PA
pros: nice way to do a deep dive into a subject and get better at teaching
cons: underutilized role, so there are times when you don’t have anything to do.

job_title: Part Time Employee in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Flexible with School and athletics
cons: low pay and hard to balance hours

job_title: Part-time Student Employee in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Very flexible with hours and the fact that employees are students first
cons: Minimum wage jobs that are relatively thankless when working with pretty spoiled wealthy students

pros: It is a beautiful campus and area. Gettysburg College is a good school. Most of the faculty and staff are nice. It is relatively easy for students to get a job on campus.
cons: Gettysburg College is a PWI - they are trying but they have a long way to go in making POC feel comfortable and respected on campus and in the area. Student wages are typically $7.25, which is the Federal minimum wage and Pennsylvania's minimum wage - I understand that this is a complex issue but many students have to work in order to continue at the College and make so little.

pros: You get to meet a ton of people.
cons: The pay is not very good.

review_title: What I needed at the time
pros: Finding a work study position was simple; I was given a list, and I chose a job. I met with my supervisor, was hired, and I kept the same job for all four years. It wasn't too hard to work while being a student -- it was a good break too.
cons: No real cons. I got more autonomy than I expected, but my situation was unique.

pros: Excellent opportunity to work while at college, with great coworkers and really feeling valued and helpful every day.
cons: Compensation should be above minimum wage for the amount of work and the complexity of work that you do, or at least the work I did in this position. You are paid more in personal satisfaction that you make a positive difference, than actual dollars.

pros: Easy and friendly people to work with.
cons: Not paid well often. Nothing else

pros: Good environment, kind people, and flexible hours.
cons: Feels a bit unorganized at times

pros: Little workload and ability to do outside work.
cons: Not a lot of hours are given per employee.

pros: Fun community, flexible hours, free meals
cons: under-staffed sometimes, pay is not great. better to work in town if possible.

job_title: Information Desk Staff in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Flexible, easy and fun and you can use it to do other work.
cons: Strict rules and policies that must be followed all times

pros: Great opportunity to learn leadership and be involved in health and wellness.
cons: Very small salary and not worth the amount of work.

pros: Amazing staff who are very friendly.
cons: I have no cons to share

pros: good coordinators and great communication with the supervisor
cons: low salary and no bonus for part-time jobs

pros: mostly supportive staff at small, close knit college; beautiful, historic campus
cons: a small minority of tenured professors rule with a reign of terror and (sometimes) pressure the admin staff to do whatever they want.

job_title: Conference and Events  Supervisor in Gettysburg, PA
pros: College tuition benefit for dependents
cons: Low pay and poor Management

job_title: Public Policy Intern in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Pick your own hours, low stress environment.
cons: Low salary for student workers and interns

pros: Great work environment to be a part of
cons: No cons come to mind about this role

pros: I get to create my own schedule, it's a relaxed work environment, I like working with my supervisors and all the professors in the English department.
cons: Communicating with the other student assistant is difficult because we always work different hours.

job_title: Circulation Desk Assistant in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Laid-back environment, able to do homework while on shift
cons: The pay is minimum wage

job_title: Peer Learning Assistant in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Good mentors who help you learn how to teach students.
cons: Low salary for a more demanding job.

job_title: Peer Learning Assistant in Gettysburg, PA
pros: flexible, great people to work with
cons: the pay is pretty low

job_title: Assistant Director of Development in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Very collaborative team, open to the sharing of ideas. All around a great place
cons: There are none that I can think of

pros: Learned so many things from them.
cons: The salary was too low.

pros:
- flexible 
- close proximity
cons:
- underpaid
- bad transportation system 
- Bad insurance

pros: Work-life balance, benefits, schedule , holidays off
cons: Minimal raise per year, sometimes less than 2%

pros: Great place to get an education
cons: Office space was pretty small

pros: Good coworkers, pleasant people to work under, nice area
cons: College poses issues for student workers

pros: Pick your own hours for the most part
cons: Really poor pay for college educated students

review_title: Undergrad Student with On-Campus Internship Opportunities
pros: A Gettysburg education provides a challenging academic experience and exposure to the professional world.
cons: I have had to complete part of my college experience remotely due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

pros: Library supports student staff well
cons: Lots of meetings and training

pros: A very fun job and good for developing skills
cons: They do not pay students very well

pros: Supportive colleagues, beautiful setting, good benefits
cons: Lack of transparency in some processes

pros: Great work environment and team atmosphere
cons: No cons love the professional atmosphere

pros: Absolutely wonderful benefits, beautiful place to work. Nice environment if you are a people person. Great if you have children attending college.
cons: Communication is often poor between departments and inside departments. If you happen to work for a department with poor management there is much inequality amongst how hourly staff is treated, and in certain areas how men vs women are treated.

pros: It truly is a supportive environment.  I have wonderful colleagues who make an effort to get along with one another.  The factions and backstabbing that are often found in academia are relatively minimal here.  People want each other to succeed, and that makes it a pleasant place to work.
cons: It can be a bit sleepy.  People are afraid to step on each others toes, which is mostly a good thing, but perhaps a little more passion and drive wouldn't hurt.

pros:
Great Benefits
Good work environment- very flexible
Friendly coworkers
cons:
Low pay
Never closes for inclement weather (even blizzards!), employees either risk driving or use their own PTO
No room to move up or grow, staff just move to the same position in different departments

pros:
*Value of work
*Excellence of leadership in president and vice presidents
*Good benefits package
*Outstanding wellness programs
*Beautiful worksite
*Access to cultural opportunities
cons: Opportunities for advancement exist, but are limited to within general job classification.  Decisions in academia can be slower than in business.

pros: Laid-back atmosphere, trusted with materials and esteemed for skills by librarians, ability to work at own place, decent amount of schedule flexibility.
cons: Can be repetitive, some limits on available times to come in to work, sometimes expected to be well versed in library-related software and writing trends.

pros: learning environment where employees learn to do different tasks through experience. generally, someone with seniority shows you how things are done, but management expects all tasks to be done efficiently and correctly.
cons: tasks and protocol for doing things aren't always clear, so it is important to ask questions if you are unsure.

review_title: Good place to work, but could be much better
pros: Good colleagues, friendly place to work, strong sense of community and emphasis on public service
cons: Low pay, politics, lack of strategic focus and vision, poor on the technology front

job_title: Student Outreach Ambassador in Gettysburg, PA
pros:
Talking with alumni, parents, and grandparents of the college
Networking and building a relationship with the alumni, parents and grand parents of the college
Easy work hours (6-9pm), very flexible work shifts 
Great work environment
cons:
Having to ask for money to parents who are already paying college tuition
Slow work nights from time to time

pros: Supervisor was very kind and organized. She understood that school came first and was willing to be flexible in the hours I worked. Training was provided and I always felt comfortable with the tasks I was assigned.
cons: Low pay. Boring, detail-oriented job. Must have a lot of concentration and patience.

review_title: Good experience as a strudent employee
job_title: Work Study Student in Gettysburg, PA
pros: The managers are very flexible with schedules to ensure that you have enough time to get your school work done. School always comes first with this college
cons: It pays minimum wage, but you cannot really complain being that it is fairly low skill jobs that for the students

pros: Great Community Environment;  Strong Academic Programs and Services. Well prepared students.
cons: Outdated technologies for mass email, phones, etc.  Overspending in some areas -- not enough spending in others.

review_title: Good staff, good work, crappy HR
pros: Some of the most excellent staff in the area, really quality, intelligent people who are hardworking and committed to good products
cons: It took over a month to get my first paycheck. Its a big company, but not that big.

pros:
Gettysburg College shows a high degree of care to its employees.
The alumni network is engaged.
Most supervisors are understanding of living a balanced life.
cons: Depending on your area within the College, there can be limited opportunity for advancement.

review_title: Great college to work at as a student
job_title: Campus Tour Guide in Gettysburg, PA
pros: employers really care about their employees, especially at the admissions office
cons: tour guides were only paid minimum wage, making it one of the lowest paying jobs on campus

review_title: Good place to work; pay slightly below peer institutions
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Friendly faculty, beautiful campus, great students
cons: Provost and faculty are often not on the same page; underfunded in comparison with some other SLACs

review_title: Consulting fellow students in professional endeavor support.
job_title: Career Outreach Assistant in Gettysburg, PA
pros: The office is very conscious to academic pursuits.
cons: Depending on the available COA's, there may be a lack of desired hours.

pros:
Speaking with alumni of Gettysburg College.
Helping the college in their fundraising and development efforts.
Highest-paying on-campus job.
cons: Slow nights when very few people are picking up our calls.

pros: I worked in several offices/departments. All of my supervisors were great to work with and great mentors.
cons: The pay is minimum wage in Pennsylvania.

pros: Great hours and pay friendly coworker get the days off u request
cons: Long hours, busy, hot cause of heat

job_title: Scene Shop Supervisor in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Flexible hours, fun coworkers, amiable supervisors, largely student operated
cons: Very little interesting work between shows, first year is now unpaid

pros: Good professional atmosphere and caring people
cons: still academic so a bit of baloney

pros: kind bosses, understanding of time off,  everyone's super nice
cons: low pay. minimum wage, submits schedule late in the week

pros: Great working environment and friendly people
cons: Pay is low and there is not much room to progress

pros: Gettysburg College gives their students many opportunities to work as student employees.
cons: I cannot think of a single con

review_title: One of the best jobs on campus
job_title: Circulation Desk Assistant in Gettysburg, PA
pros: Easy, light work. They let you do homework.
cons: Not much. I had a good experience.

pros: Flexible hours, freedom of curriculum, reimbursement for trainings
cons: Limited hours and budget for the high demand of trainers

pros: Amazing networking and alumni connections for a variety of careers
cons: Small school and feels very secluded

pros: Extremely flexible work hours, perfect for busy students.
cons: Hourly wage is low at 7.25 an hour.

pros: Great people, interesting work, flexible with student schedules.
cons: Office is not on campus

pros: Friendly manager and fun co-worker
cons: Low pay and sometimes monotonous work
